bug.short_desc: Hint for including code snippets in API documentation

long_desc.thetext:
Now I know that I can use <pre> to include source code snippets in the API documentation. This hint should be included in the narrative documentation http://manual.qooxdoo.org/1.6.x/pages/development/write_api_documentation.html
By the way, the most popular page for "qooxdoo writing documentation" is http://qooxdoo.org/documentation/0.8/write_api_documentation from the version 0.8. There is no link from the old page to the current version and the current version documentation has a different url structure http://manual.qooxdoo.org/1.6.x/pages/development/write_api_documentation.html So it took some time for me to find the current version of the document.

(In reply to comment #1) > Now I know that I can use <pre> to include source code snippets in the API > documentation. This hint should be included in the narrative documentation > http://manual.qooxdoo.org/1.6.x/pages/development/write_api_documentation.html
Good point.
> By the way, the most popular page for "qooxdoo writing documentation" is > http://qooxdoo.org/documentation/0.8/write_api_documentation from the version > 0.8.
Most popular in terms of Google?!
> There is no link from the old page to the current version and
Well, actually there is one, right at the top of the page. It says "This is documentation for qooxdoo 0.8.x only. You might be interested in consulting the latest docs.", and "latest docs" is a link to the documentation overview page (where you can pick the version most appropriate for you).
> the current version documentation has a different url structure > http://manual.qooxdoo.org/1.6.x/pages/development/write_api_documentation.html > So it took some time for me to find the current version of the document.
Using the search tool on the qooxdoo home page lets you select the qooxdoo version you are interested in. You will find "Writing API Documentation" as the last entry of the search results (as they are sorted alphabetically by document title :-).

Added a paragraph about HTML markup to the manual.
